wikipedia_page.main: The Reverend Arthur Richard Shilleto (18 June 1848 – 19 January 1894) was a British clergyman and schoolmaster. He was the son of the classicist Richard Shilleto (1809–1876).

response: He was educated at Repton and Shrewsbury, then Trinity College, Cambridge, where he graduated second classic in 1832. Though Shilleto did not become a fellow of Trinity, marrying Isabella S. H. Snelgar in 1834, he spent the rest of his life in Cambridge as a 'coach'(private tutor) in classics. His son Arthur Richard Shilleto was born in 1848. In 1867 he was elected a fellow of Peterhouse.
*Arthur Richard Shilleto (1848–1894), second master of King Edward VI School, Stratford-upon-AvonHarrow, 1800–1911, p. 346
From 1879 to 1882 the master was Arthur Richard Shilleto.
